LGTM :+1:

I browsed the code and found out that this "templateSize = int(int(templates[0].size) / (1024**3))" was already been used in other places. So, your changes does make sense to me and therefore you get a LGTM :+1: 

Cheers,
Wilder

Travis failed due to a timeout.

I will have a look at the code.
hey @bhaisaab, still WIP. I ask for some help to finish it on the ML, because I will not have time to work on it the next months.

@bhaisaab @DaanHoogland , could you also have a look at this one?

It LGTM

Cheers,

LGTM

Hi @resmo and @bhaisaab 

I will check with @remibergsma / @DaanHoogland / @snuf if that's something we could get involved in. I'm okay with helping, as long as I have some time dedicated in our sprints.

Would you have some more details on how far you are, @resmo ? Will it break existing functionality if we merge? If not and if I get the time, we can get it merge and I will continue from where you left.

Cheers,
Wilder
LGTM :+1:
This seems to me to be a solution for vmware for a more generic problem. in the generic code conditions for hypervisortype == vmware are set while the problem is generic over hypervisor typos.

Hi @wido 
I've been waiting for feedback from Pyr on a thread in the dev mailing list with subject "4.6" if you want to look it up.
I will nevertheless do what @wilderrodrigues suggested and break it down, and will also remove the mysql bit, or make it non-default to be compliant with Apache licensing rules, regardless of the Oracle licensing exception.
Unfortunately i've not had any time to work on ACS for the past couple of weeks since i've just relocated to Dublin, and it might take a couple more before I have the time to pick it up.
Cheers,
Rafael

[cloudstack-pull-rats #62](https://builds.apache.org/job/cloudstack-pull-rats/62/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

Hi @wilderrodrigues that would be awesome!

It is not supposed to break backward compatibility. In my opinion the functionality is implemented and should work, but I hadn't a change to really test it and the current tests are not green as well. So adding unit tests and looking at the current unit tests is needed.

As it is my first serious work in cloudstack, don't hesitate to correct any mistake I made. :)

Hi @resmo 

Can I then get your changes, from your PR, work on it and push via another PR? Would that be okay with you?

If so, I think we could close this PR. What do you think? @bhaisaab @DaanHoogland your thoughts on that...?

Cheers,
Wilder

LGTM.
Good to see this patch updating chain information for all 3 cases of storage migration, 
1) volume migration
2) vm migration with storage within cluster
3) vm migration across storage within cluster

LGTM.
Device id 7 on virtual SCSI (can be of any sub type : LsiLogic, LsiSAS, BusLogic, Paravirtual) controller is reserved for controller itself, rest all virtual nodes could be used for virtual disks.

I actually encountered this issue today on a running 4.5.2 deployment build from the 4.5 branch.

Since this one got 3 LGTM's but there are outstanding test requests, how to proceed? Do I merge it or wait for the tests?
Wido, I want tests but if three other people want to merge it I'm not going to stand between them and the repo on my own. (btw I shouldn't have to)

The tests have been fixed, Mocking issue in the test.

Its not always safe. http://stackoverflow.com/a/14837457/201514
In our example, the threads unnecessarily wait for 1000 ms if the previous threads exited from a path which doesnt do a notify
updated code looks good to me. :+1:
LGTM, how about the alert @bhaisaab asked for?
@DaanHoogland It is in the KVMFencer in the MGMT server. The Agent can't send an alert, so I had to do this in the mgmt server.
